meanings.definition: Loud and enthusiastic approval or praise.
meanings.sent1: The crowd erupted in acclamation when the singer took the stage.
meanings.sent2: The team received great acclamation for their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The acclamation for the delicious cake was so loud, it could be heard from the next room.
meanings.sent4: Her performance was met with acclamation that echoed through the auditorium.
meanings.sent5: The acclamation for the hero's bravery was heard far and wide.

meanings.definition: An oral vote, especially an enthusiastic vote of approval.
meanings.sent1: The unanimous acclamation of the audience showed their support for the proposal.
meanings.sent2: The acclamation of the crowd sealed the victory for the contestant.
meanings.sent3: The acclamation for the new student council president was so loud, it startled the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The acclamation of the fans was like music to the athlete's ears.
meanings.sent5: The acclamation of the audience was a clear sign of their satisfaction.

meanings.sent3: The acclamation for the winning team was so loud, it set off car alarms.
meanings.sent4: The acclamation of the crowd was like a wave of positivity.
meanings.sent5: The acclamation of the audience was a testament to the performer's talent.
